description: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.

name: Swoobat
description: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.

name: Drilbur
description: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

name: Excadrill
description: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.

name: Audino
description: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.

name: Timburr
description: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.

name: Gurdurr
description: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.

name: Conkeldurr
description: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.

name: Tympole
description: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.

name: Palpitoad
description: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

name: Seismitoad
description: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.

name: Throh
description: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.

name: Sawk
description: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.

name: Sewaddle
description: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

name: Swadloon
description: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

name: Leavanny
description: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

name: Venipede
description: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.

name: Whirlipede
description: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.

name: Scolipede
description: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.

name: Cottonee
description: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

name: Whimsicott
description: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

name: Petilil
description: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.

name: Lilligant
description: It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head to bloom.

name: Basculin
description: Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch— many people release them into lakes illicitly.

name: Sandile
description: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.

name: Krokorok
description: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.

name: Krookodile
description: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.

name: Darumaka
description: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.

name: Darmanitan
description: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.

name: Maractus
description: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

name: Dwebble
description: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.

name: Crustle
description: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.

name: Scraggy
description: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

name: Scrafty
description: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.

name: Sigilyph
description: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.

name: Yamask
description: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.

name: Cofagrigus
description: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.

name: Tirtouga
description: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.

name: Carracosta
description: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.

name: Archen
description: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.

name: Archeops
description: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.

name: Trubbish
description: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

name: Garbodor
description: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

name: Zorua
description: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.

name: Zoroark
description: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.

name: Minccino
description: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

name: Cinccino
description: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

name: Gothita
description: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.

name: Gothorita
description: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.

name: Gothitelle
description: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.

name: Solosis
description: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.

name: Duosion
description: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.

name: Reuniclus
description: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.

name: Ducklett
description: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

name: Swanna
description: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

name: Vanillite
description: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.

name: Vanillish
description: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.

name: Vanilluxe
description: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.

name: Deerling
description: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

name: Sawsbuck
description: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

name: Emolga
description: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.

name: Karrablast
description: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

name: Escavalier
description: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.

name: Foongus
description: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.

name: Amoonguss
description: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.

name: Frillish
description: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.

name: Jellicent
description: Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.

name: Alomomola
description: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.

name: Joltik
description: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.

name: Galvantula
description: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

name: Ferroseed
description: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

name: Ferrothorn
description: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

name: Klink
description: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.

name: Klang
description: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.

name: Klinklang
description: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.

name: Tynamo
description: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Eelektrik
description: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

name: Eelektross
description: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

name: Elgyem
description: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.

name: Beheeyem
description: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.

name: Litwick
description: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.

name: Lampent
description: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.

name: Chandelure
description: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.

name: Axew
description: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.

name: Fraxure
description: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.

name: Haxorus
description: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.

name: Cubchoo
description: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.

name: Beartic
description: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.

name: Cryogonal
description: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.

name: Shelmet
description: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

name: Accelgor
description: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.

name: Stunfisk
description: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.

name: Mienfoo
description: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.

name: Mienshao
description: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.

name: Druddigon
description: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.

name: Golett
description: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.

name: Golurk
description: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.

name: Pawniard
description: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

name: Bisharp
description: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

name: Bouffalant
description: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.

name: Rufflet
description: If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses, it starts bawling.

name: Braviary
description: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.

name: Vullaby
description: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.

name: Mandibuzz
description: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.

name: Heatmor
description: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

name: Durant
description: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

name: Deino
description: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.

name: Zweilous
description: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.

name: Hydreigon
description: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.

name: Larvesta
description: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.

name: Volcarona
description: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.

name: Cobalion
description: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.

name: Terrakion
description: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

name: Virizion
description: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.

name: Tornadus
description: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

name: Thundurus
description: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

name: Reshiram
description: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

name: Zekrom
description: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

name: Landorus
description: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

name: Kyurem
description: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

name: Keldeo
description: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

name: Meloetta
description: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

name: Genesect
description: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

name: Chespin
description: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

name: Quilladin
description: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

name: Chesnaught
description: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

name: Fennekin
description: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Braixen
description: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

name: Delphox
description: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

name: Froakie
description: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

name: Frogadier
description: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

name: Greninja
description: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

name: Bunnelby
description: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

name: Diggersby
description: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.

name: Fletchling
description: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.

name: Fletchinder
description: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.

name: Talonflame
description: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.

name: Scatterbug
description: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

name: Spewpa
description: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

name: Vivillon
description: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

name: Litleo
description: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.

name: Pyroar
description: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

name: Flabébé
description: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

name: Floette
description: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.

name: Florges
description: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.

name: Skiddo
description: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

name: Gogoat
description: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

name: Pancham
description: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

name: Pangoro
description: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

name: Furfrou
description: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.

name: Espurr
description: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.

name: Meowstic
description: Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.

name: Honedge
description: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.

name: Doublade
description: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

name: Aegislash
description: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.

name: Spritzee
description: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.

name: Aromatisse
description: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.

name: Swirlix
description: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.

name: Slurpuff
description: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.

name: Inkay
description: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.

name: Malamar
description: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.

name: Binacle
description: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

name: Barbaracle
description: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

name: Skrelp
description: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

name: Dragalge
description: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.

name: Clauncher
description: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.

name: Clawitzer
description: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.

name: Helioptile
description: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.

name: Heliolisk
description: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

name: Tyrunt
description: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.

name: Tyrantrum
description: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.

name: Amaura
description: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.

name: Aurorus
description: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.

name: Sylveon
description: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.

name: Hawlucha
description: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.

name: Dedenne
description: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.

name: Carbink
description: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.

name: Goomy
description: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.

name: Sliggoo
description: Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.

name: Goodra
description: Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.

name: Klefki
description: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.

name: Phantump
description: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.

name: Trevenant
description: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.

name: Pumpkaboo
description: Spirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.

name: Gourgeist
description: Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.

name: Bergmite
description: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.

name: Avalugg
description: At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.

name: Noibat
description: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.

name: Noivern
description: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.

name: Xerneas
description: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

name: Yveltal
description: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

name: Zygarde
description: This is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.

name: Diancie
description: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

name: Hoopa
description: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

name: Volcanion
description: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

name: Rowlet
description: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.

name: Dartrix
description: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

name: Decidueye
description: It nocks its arrow quills and shoots them at opponents. When it simply can’t afford to miss, it tugs the vine on its head to improve its focus.

name: Litten
description: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

name: Torracat
description: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.

name: Incineroar
description: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.

name: Popplio
description: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.

name: Brionne
description: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.

name: Primarina
description: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.

name: Pikipek
description: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.

name: Trumbeak
description: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.

name: Toucannon
description: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.

name: Yungoos
description: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.

name: Gumshoos
description: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.

name: Grubbin
description: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.

name: Charjabug
description: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.

name: Vikavolt
description: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.

name: Crabrawler
description: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

name: Crabominable
description: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

name: Oricorio
description: It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.

name: Cutiefly
description: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.

name: Ribombee
description: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.

name: Rockruff
description: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.

name: Lycanroc
description: This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks jutting from its mane are razor sharp.

name: Wishiwashi
description: Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by gathering up into schools that they’re able to confront opponents.

name: Mareanie
description: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.

name: Toxapex
description: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.

name: Mudbray
description: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.

name: Mudsdale
description: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

name: Dewpider
description: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.

name: Araquanid
description: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.

name: Fomantis
description: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.

name: Lurantis
description: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.

name: Morelull
description: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.

name: Shiinotic
description: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.

name: Salandit
description: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.

name: Salazzle
description: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

name: Stufful
description: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

name: Bewear
description: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.

name: Bounsweet
description: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.

name: Steenee
description: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.

name: Tsareena
description: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.

name: Comfey
description: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.

name: Oranguru
description: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.

name: Passimian
description: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.

name: Wimpod
description: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

name: Golisopod
description: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.

name: Sandygast
description: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.

name: Palossand
description: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.

name: Pyukumuku
description: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

name: Type: Null
description: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.

name: Silvally
description: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.

name: Minior
description: It lives in the ozone layer, where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.

name: Komala
description: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.

name: Turtonator
description: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

name: Togedemaru
description: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.

name: Mimikyu
description: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.

name: Bruxish
description: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.

name: Drampa
description: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

name: Dhelmise
description: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

name: Jangmo-o
description: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.

name: Hakamo-o
description: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.

name: Kommo-o
description: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.

name: Tapu Koko
description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

name: Tapu Lele
description: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.

name: Tapu Bulu
description: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

name: Tapu Fini
description: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

name: Cosmog
description: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.

name: Cosmoem
description: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

name: Solgaleo
description: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.

name: Lunala
description: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”

name: Nihilego
description: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.

name: Buzzwole
description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Pheromosa
description: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.

name: Xurkitree
description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Celesteela
description: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.

name: Kartana
description: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

name: Guzzlord
description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Necrozma
description: It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.

name: Magearna
description: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

name: Marshadow
description: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

name: Poipole
description: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

name: Naganadel
description: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

name: Stakataka
description: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

name: Blacephalon
description: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Zeraora
description: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

name: Meltan
description: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

name: Melmetal
description: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.

name: Grookey
description: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

name: Thwackey
description: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

name: Rillaboom
description: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

name: Scorbunny
description: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

name: Raboot
description: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

name: Cinderace
description: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

name: Sobble
description: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

name: Drizzile
description: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

name: Inteleon
description: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

name: Skwovet
description: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

name: Greedent
description: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.

name: Rookidee
description: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

name: Corvisquire
description: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

name: Corviknight
description: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

name: Blipbug
description: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.

name: Dottler
description: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

name: Orbeetle
description: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

name: Nickit
description: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

name: Thievul
description: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

name: Gossifleur
description: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

name: Eldegoss
description: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

name: Wooloo
description: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

name: Dubwool
description: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

name: Chewtle
description: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

name: Drednaw
description: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

name: Yamper
description: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

name: Boltund
description: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

name: Rolycoly
description: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

name: Carkol
description: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

name: Coalossal
description: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Applin
description: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.

name: Flapple
description: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

name: Appletun
description: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

name: Silicobra
description: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

name: Sandaconda
description: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

name: Cramorant
description: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

name: Arrokuda
description: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.

name: Barraskewda
description: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

name: Toxel
description: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

name: Toxtricity
description: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.

name: Sizzlipede
description: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

name: Centiskorch
description: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

name: Clobbopus
description: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

name: Grapploct
description: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

name: Sinistea
description: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

name: Polteageist
description: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

name: Hatenna
description: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

name: Hattrem
description: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

name: Hatterene
description: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

name: Impidimp
description: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

name: Morgrem
description: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

name: Grimmsnarl
description: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

name: Obstagoon
description: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

name: Perrserker
description: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

name: Cursola
description: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

name: Sirfetch’d
description: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

name: Mr. Rime
description: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

name: Runerigus
description: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

name: Milcery
description: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

name: Alcremie
description: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

name: Falinks
description: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.

name: Pincurchin
description: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

name: Snom
description: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

name: Frosmoth
description: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Stonjourner
description: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

name: Eiscue
description: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

name: Indeedee
description: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

name: Morpeko
description: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

name: Cufant
description: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

name: Copperajah
description: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.

name: Dracozolt
description: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

name: Arctozolt
description: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

name: Dracovish
description: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

name: Arctovish
description: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

name: Duraludon
description: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

name: Dreepy
description: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

name: Drakloak
description: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

name: Dragapult
description: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

name: Zacian
description: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

name: Zamazenta
description: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

name: Eternatus
description: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

name: Kubfu
description: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

name: Urshifu
description: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

name: Zarude
description: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

name: Regieleki
description: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.

name: Regidrago
description: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

name: Glastrier
description: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

name: Spectrier
description: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

name: Calyrex
description: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
